definition: infix (grammar), particle attached within a word or expression
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
to sew/to stitch together/to combine/to link/to connect/to put words together/to compose/to embellish

sentences.english: Blade suddenly proposed several times should be forced to complete the dedication to become sworn midfix.
sentences.chinese: 刀锋忽然间提议应将几次被迫中缀的结拜之礼完成。

sentences.english: Read the infix expression from left to right, one character at a time.
sentences.chinese: 从左到右读入中缀表达式，每次一个字符。

sentences.english: The infix index would match substrings anywhere within the string.
sentences.chinese: 中缀索引将匹配在字符串内任意位置的子字符串。

sentences.english: To RenShun comments from the sky, because timeout program infix.
sentences.chinese: 到仁顺发表意见的时分，由于超时节目被中缀。

definition: to sew/to stitch together/to combine/to link/to connect/to put words together/to compose/to embellish
many stars/a vast sky full of stars
to flash before one's eyes/to flicker
bare and bald (of mountains)/bright and brilliant/fat and sleek
branches and tendrils/fig. overcomplicated or digressive
